items.title: Ethereum co-founder reiterates support for Roman Storm, citing privacy
items.summary: The Tornado Cash developer was found guilty of operating an unlicensed transmitter business in August and could still be retried on two counts on which a jury deadlocked.

items.title: Security expert Bruce Schneier ‘guarantees’ governments are bulk spying with AI
items.summary: From PRISM to AI, mass surveillance has only grown more powerful. Bruce Schneier warns the post-Snowden world may be entering an even darker phase.

items.title: Bitcoin price clings to $90K as traders eye US Supreme Court tariff ruling
items.summary: Bitcoin traders avoided taking positions amid sideways BTC price action, while markets waited for a decision on US trade tariffs by the Supreme Court.

items.title: Bitcoin RSI hints at $105K BTC price rebound as bull signals multiply
items.summary: Bitcoin RSI flipped bullish on several timeframes, leading one trader to a $105,000 BTC price target within "three to four weeks."

items.title: Ripple scores UK regulatory approval via local subsidiary
items.summary: Ripple’s UK subsidiary gained regulatory approval as an Electronic Money Institution to provide payment services, but faces limits on certain crypto activities.

items.title: Sharplink pockets $33M from Ether staking, deploys another $170M ETH
items.summary: Corporate crypto treasuries are increasingly turning to Ether staking, as companies like SharpLink generate recurring yield from onchain operations.

items.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
items.summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

items.title: Visa-linked stablecoin platform Rain raises $250M at $1.95B valuation
items.summary: The raise values Rain at $1.95 billion after 30-fold card growth in 2025, with the Visa-linked platform planning expansion across multiple continents.

items.title: The hidden risk of public WiFi: How a single approval wiped a crypto wallet
items.summary: A crypto user who lost $5,000 from a hot wallet after a stay at a hotel said the real culprits were open WiFi, a casual lobby phone call and one careless wallet approval.

items.title: Grayscale forms trusts tied to potential BNB and HYPE ETFs
items.summary: Grayscale registered Delaware trusts linked to potential BNB and HYPE ETPs, an early step that often precedes but does not guarantee ETF filings.

items.title: Zcash sees developer slowdown as ZEC extends two-month slide
items.summary: Zcash developer activity has fallen to its lowest level since 2021 as a governance dispute weighs on sentiment and ZEC extends a two-month decline.

items.title: Vulnerability found in Babylon staking code could slow block production
items.summary: A newly discovered vulnerability may enable malicious validators to omit the hash field when posting blocks, leading to validator crashes and slowing block production.

items.title: Bitcoin and Ether ETFs shed over $1B as early 2026 inflows reverse
items.summary: After a brief January rebound, US spot Bitcoin and Ether ETFs saw heavy redemptions, extending a cautious trend that began after October’s market reset.

items.title: FCA sets September 2026 start for UK crypto licensing applications
items.summary: UK crypto businesses must secure FCA authorization well before the crypto regime starts in October 2027 or face transitional restrictions on new services.

items.title: South Korea’s top court rules exchange-held Bitcoin can be seized
items.summary: The ruling confirms that Bitcoin in South Korean exchange accounts is an “object of seizure” under criminal law, aligning Seoul with US and EU enforcement practices.

items.title: Iran is cut off from the internet: Here’s how crypto could still work
items.summary: Protests began in Iran in response to worsening economic conditions and as the Iranian rial hit record lows against the US dollar.

items.title: Crypto market crash last October marked end of ‘easy yield’ era: BitMEX
items.summary: BitMEX says the era of easy money via arbitrage trades likely died in the October crash, as a liquidation spiral left many market makers naked.

items.title: Stablecoin flows could near $56T by 2030: Bloomberg
items.summary: Increased adoption of stablecoins by institutions and countries with economic instability could drive stablecoin payment flows to $56 trillion by 2030.

items.title: Bitcoin is now 56.7% green: Here’s how it could get even cleaner
items.summary: Bitcoin mining is accelerating renewable energy deployment, replacing fossil-fuel heating, expanding energy access and cutting methane emissions at scale.

items.title: Zcash devs unveil ‘cashZ’ wallet after exiting Electric Coin Co
items.summary: Employees who left the Electric Coin Company en masse on Wednesday are launching a new Zcash wallet, citing the need to return to cypherpunk principles and to scale faster.

items.title: Optimism floats OP buyback proposal using Superchain revenue
items.summary: A new plan would tie OP token value to network performance by using half of all Superchain fee revenue for systematic repurchases.

items.title: Global sanctions linked to record flows into illicit crypto addresses
items.summary: The Global Sanctions Inflation Index estimated there were just under 80,000 total sanctioned entities and persons globally as of May 2025.

items.title: Bitcoin to hit $2.9M by 2050 as it muscles into global trade: VanEck
items.summary: VanEck analysts said Bitcoin could handle 5–10% of global trade and make up 2.5% of central bank reserves by 2050, driving its strategic role as a monetary hedge.

items.title: Coinbase lands 2nd ‘buy’ rating in a week, with BofA seeing 38% upside
items.summary: Bank of America upgraded Coinbase after easing tax-loss selling and shifting short interest, citing product expansion and long-term onchain ambitions.

items.title: Revived NY bill targets sports, politics and death prediction markets
items.summary: New York lawmakers will soon review a bill that seeks to ban certain sports and political event contracts in the state, among others.

items.title: Nexo to offer zero-interest crypto lending for BTC and ETH holders
items.summary: The offering expands Nexo’s structured lending products to Bitcoin and Ether holders amid a broader recovery in crypto-backed lending.

items.title: CFTC issues no-action letter to Bitnomial, clearing way for event contracts
items.summary: The no-action letter comes amid growing acceptance by US regulators of prediction-style markets and event contracts during an election year.

items.title: Trump rules out Sam Bankman-Fried pardon in NYT interview
items.summary: The US president reportedly said he had no intention of pardoning the former FTX CEO, and defended his family’s connections to the crypto industry.

items.title: Bitcoin bulls chase $91K as early 2026 rally finds sustained volume
items.summary: Bitcoin bulls are making a run on $91,000 as start-of-the-year trading volumes highlight the market’s expectation of a positive Q1.

items.title: Truebit token price falls 99% after reports of $26M exploit
items.summary: The TRU price fell to $0.0000000029 from $0.16 after the protocol reported a security incident and crypto sleuths tracked stolen Ether.
